meanings.sent1: I had to recalculated my math homework to make sure I got the right answer.
meanings.sent2: She recalculated the total cost of the groceries after realizing she forgot to include the tax.
meanings.sent3: After the robot recalculated the numbers, it started dancing in excitement.
meanings.sent4: The scientist recalculated the data, revealing a new pattern hidden within.
meanings.sent5: The detective recalculated the clues, finally solving the mystery.

meanings.definition: To reevaluate or reassess a calculation.
meanings.sent1: He recalculated the budget to see if there was any room for additional expenses.
meanings.sent2: The engineer recalculated the measurements to ensure the bridge was safe to cross.
meanings.sent3: The cat recalculated the distance to jump, then gracefully leaped onto the couch.
meanings.sent4: The teacher recalculated the grades, giving the students a second chance to improve.
meanings.sent5: The chef recalculated the recipe, adding a pinch of spice for extra flavor.
